original: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā sāvatthiyam viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme
translated: On one occasion the Blessed One was dwelling at Savatthi in Jeta’s Grove, Anathapindika’s Park.

original: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro icchānaṅgalako upāsako sāvatthiṁ anuppatto hoti kenacideva karaṇīyena.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena aññataraḥ icchānaṅgalakaḥ upāsakaḥ sāvatthim an uppattaḥ hoti kenacid eva karaṇīyena
translated: Now on that occasion a certain lay follower from Icchanangala had arrived at Savatthi for some business or other.

original: Atha kho so upāsako sāvatthiyaṁ taṁ karaṇīyaṁ tīretvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi.
analyzed: atha kho saḥ upāsakaḥ sāvatthiyam tam karaṇīyam tīretvā yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdi
translated: Then, having concluded his business at Savatthi, he went to the Blessed One, and after paying homage to him, sat down at one side.

original: Ekamantaṁ nisinnaṁ kho taṁ upāsakaṁ bhagavā etadavoca:
analyzed: eka mantam nisinnam khalu tam upāsakam bhagavān etat avoca

original: “cirassaṁ kho tvaṁ, upāsaka, imaṁ pariyāyamakāsi yadidaṁ idhāgamanāyā”ti.
analyzed: cirassam kho tvam upāsakaḥ imam pariyāyam akāsi yat idam idha āgamanāya ati
translated: “Lay follower, it is long since you took the opportunity to come here.”

original: “Cirapaṭikāhaṁ, bhante, bhagavantaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamitukāmo, api cāhaṁ kehici kehici kiccakaraṇīyehi byāvaṭo. Evāhaṁ nāsakkhiṁ bhagavantaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamitun”ti.
analyzed: cirapaṭikā āha bhante bhagavantam dassanāya upasaṅkamitu kāmo api ca aham kehici kehici kicca karaṇīyehi byāvaṭaḥ eva aham na asakkhim bhagavantam dassanāya upasaṅkamitunti
translated: “For a long time, venerable sir, I have wanted to come to see the Blessed One, but I have been hindered by too many duties and responsibilities. That is why I have not been able to come to see the Blessed One.”

original: Atha kho bhagavā etamatthaṁ viditvā tāyaṁ velāyaṁ imaṁ udānaṁ udānesi:
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā etam attham viditvā tāyam velāyam imam udānam udānesi
translated: Then, the Blessed One, having known the significance of it, on that occasion uttered this exalted utterance:

analyzed: sukham vata tassa na hoti kiñci
translated: “He who has no possessions at all,
who has contemplated the Dhamma and is learned,
sees the one who has possessions being tormented,
the person who is bound to people. ”
